actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to amend title 18 of the United States code to prohibit certain types of vote tampering.
short_title: Voter Suppression, Ballot Hacking, and Election Fraud Prevention Act
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Voter Suppression, Ballot Hacking, and Election Fraud Prevention Act - Amends the federal criminal code to prohibit interference with or attempts to affect an election of a presidential or congressional candidate or ballot initiative by tampering with a voting system, discarding ballots, or altering a vote. Imposes a fine and/or prison term of up to 20 years for violations.Allows individuals whose right to vote is interfered with due to violations of this Act to bring a civil action in federal court and recover damages up to $10,000.

titles.title: Voter Suppression, Ballot Hacking, and Election Fraud Prevention Act
A bill to amend title 18 of the United States code to prohibit certain types of vote tampering.
